title: How to know if I can use a name for a character - Quora

response.answer_text: If you use a particular person’s name and it is identifiable, they could sue you for unlicensed use of their name, Before retiring, I taught composition. If you just want a name for a character, here’s an easy way to get one. When students were writing fiction, I forbade them to use the name of any student or staff member at the school. I had some books which they could use for names. Two of them were lists of baby names and the names’ meanings. This was useful if the author wanted the name to be a reflection of the character’s personality. The other was the telephone book. Students would open the book to a random age, shut their eyes, and put their finger on the page. If it happened that they knew that person, they did it again, but if not, that person’s last name became the last name of their character. By choosing names this way, nobody could get bothered and say that the student author was ridiculing them.

Simple, is it a word-for-word ripoff of an existing character? Then no, you will get yourself into lawsuits left and right. You can use the same name as existing characters in media, i.e. conan or ana, because nobody can copyright a name, but the CHARACTERS can be, so you have to make them different enough to not qualify as misrepresentation or copyright infringement. For example, you want to use the name Ana for a character and don’t want to get in trouble, just use a different last name, or use it on a character whose personality is completely different from the characters in public media.
